page.title: 02Wormleighton The Landscape
page.content: This area is just north of the Cotswolds and its contours are similar, rolling hills crossed by small roads or tracks leading to stone built farmhouses. The village itself is the only area of housing to any degree and little new building has been done for the past one hundred years. The hillsides are divided into fields, some have sheep or cattle in them and others have crops growing. There are three small copses of deciduous woodland and trees are planted alongside the roads and in the hedgerows giving an overall picture of a typical English countryside. Numerous springs rise in the area and even today are used in the outlying farms for drinking.
